newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile's CTC eyes Telebras sale.
newsitem.headline: Chile's CTC eyes Telebras sale.

text.p: Chile's largest telecom Compania de Telecomunicaciones de Chile is very interested in bidding in the privatization of Brazil's Telebras, said CTC president Claudio Garcia.
"We are thinking about Brazil and specifically about Telebras," Garcia told reporters.
"Once Telebras decides how the privatization will take place, we will be the first to be interested in taking part."
Garcia said CTC is also interested in investments in other countries in Latin America.
"We will study all the opportunities in Latin America. People from Telefonica de Espana are studying the situation in Ecuador," he said.
CTC is 43-percent owned by Spain's Telefonica de Espana .
CTC and Telefonica are part of the consortium that bought a 35 percent stake in Brazilian firm Companhia Riograndense de Telecomunicaciones in December.
